name: Complete blood count
des: A routine complete blood count (CBC) checks for levels of 10 different components of every major cell in your blood: white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

name: Ultrasonography
des: A procedure that uses high-energy sound waves to look at tissues and organs inside the body. The sound waves make echoes that form pictures of the tissues and organs on a computer screen (sonogram).

name: Basic metabolic panel
des: A basic metabolic panel (BMP) usually checks for levels of eight compounds in the blood-calcium, glucose, sodium, potassium, bicarbonate, chloride,  blood urea nitrogen (BUN), creatinine.
